verses.text: The preparations of the heart in man, and the answer of the tongue, \add are\add* from the LORD.
All the ways of a man \add are\add* clean in his own eyes; but the LORD weigheth the spirits.
Commit thy works to the LORD, and thy thoughts shall be established.
The LORD hath made all \add things\add* for himself: yes, even the wicked for the day of evil.
Every one \add that is\add* proud in heart \add is\add* an abomination to the LORD: \add though\add* hand \add join\add* in hand, he shall not be unpunished.
By mercy and truth iniquity is purged: and by the fear of the LORD \add men\add* depart from evil.
When a man's ways please the LORD, he maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.
Better \add is\add* a little with righteousness, than great revenues without right.
A man's heart deviseth his way: but the LORD directeth his steps.
A divine sentence \add is\add* in the lips of the king: his mouth transgresseth not in judgment.
A just weight and balance \add are\add* the LORD'S: all the weights of the bag \add are\add* his work.
\add It is\add* an abomination to kings to commit wickedness: for the throne is established by righteousness.
Righteous lips \add are\add* the delight of kings; and they love him that speaketh right.
The wrath of a king \add is as\add* messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.
In the light of a king's countenance \add is\add* life; and his favor \add is\add* as a cloud of the latter rain.
How much better \add is it\add* to get wisdom than gold? and to get understanding rather to be chosen than silver?
The highway of the upright \add is\add* to depart from evil: he that keepeth his way preserveth his soul.
Pride \add goeth\add* before destruction, and a haughty spirit before a fall.
Better \add it is to be\add* of a humble spirit with the lowly, than to divide the spoil with the proud.
He that handleth a matter wisely shall find good: and whoever trusteth in the LORD, happy \add is\add* he.
The wise in heart shall be called prudent: and the sweetness of the lips increaseth learning.
Understanding \add is\add* a well-spring of life to him that hath it: but the instruction of fools \add is\add* folly.
The heart of the wise teacheth his mouth, and addeth learning to his lips.
Pleasant words \add are as\add* a honey-comb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.
There is a way that seemeth right to a man, but the end of it \add is\add* the ways of death.
He that laboreth laboreth for himself; for his mouth craveth it of him.
An ungodly man diggeth up evil: and in his lips \add there is\add* as a burning fire.
A froward man soweth strife: and a whisperer separateth chief friends.
A violent man enticeth his neighbor, and leadeth him into the way \add that is\add* not good.
He shutteth his eyes to devise froward things: moving his lips he bringeth evil to pass.
The hoary head \add is\add* a crown of glory, \add if\add* it is found in the way of righteousness.
\add He that is\add* slow to anger \add is\add* better than the mighty; and he that ruleth his spirit, than he that taketh a city.
The lot is cast into the lap: but the whole disposing of it \add is\add* from the LORD.
